question.text: Which of the following is not a part of a typical embryo sac formation in angiosperms?

options.text: The MMC undergoes meiotic division to form 4 megaspores.
Three mitotic divisions occur in a megaspore to form an eight nucleate stage.
The cell walls are formed with 3 cells grouped together at chalazal end, together called the egg apparatus.
The egg apparatus contains two synergids and one egg cell.

solution.text: The MMC undergoes meiotic division to form 4 megaspores. There are 3 mitotic divisions that forms 8 nucleate stage. The cell walls are formed with 3 cells grouped together at the micropylar end called the egg apparatus. There are three cells at chalazal end that are called antipodal cells which degenerate during fertilization. There are also two centrally placed nuclei called polar nuclei.
